image.altText: A burned out plane on a runway

props.synopsis: As investigators piece together what led to a fatal crash on the runway at Tokyo's Haneda Airport this week, aviation experts say this will be another opportunity for the industry to learn valuable lessons.

title.children: When the Japan Airlines plane caught fire, passengers made one choice that may have saved them

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: An aerial view of houses and commercial buildings in the middle of Lismore, totally surrounded by floods.

props.synopsis: The desperation and despair of flood victims has been laid bare by submissions to a federal inquiry into the insurance industry's response to the 2022 floods, which resulted in claims worth a total $7.4 billion being lodged.

title.children: Federal inquiry to probe claims of a 'confusopoly' of 'soul-crushing' insurance nightmares after 2022 floods

image.altText: A massive crack in a bitumen road with vegetation behind it

props.synopsis: Far North Queensland farmers say their transport costs have skyrocketed due to flood damage closing the Palmerston Highway and, while some are trying to absorb the costs, they warn it is not sustainable in the long term.

title.children: Palmerston Highway closure lifts the cost of bringing Far North produce to consumers

image.altText: Oxygen masks dangle in front of several plane seats with the window missing from a plane.

props.synopsis: The incident occurred shortly after take-off and the gaping hole caused the cabin to depressurise.

title.children: Plane loses window mid-flight in Oregon US, airline grounds all Boeing 737-9 aircraft

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A man in a yellow top has mouth open wearing a cap.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur has continued his stunning pre-Australian Open form with a come-from-behind win over German star Alexander Zverev.

title.children: Alex de Minaur downs Alexander Zverev as Aussies level United Cup semi

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka fist pumping.

props.synopsis: Tennis fans will get an early taste of what the Australian Open final could be when Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina face off in the Brisbane International final.

title.children: Sabalenka sets up Australian Open final rematch with Rybakina in Brisbane

image.altText: Smoke rises from village.

props.synopsis: Lebanon's Hezbollah militia fires dozens of rockets at northern Israel on Saturday as top US and EU diplomats visited the region to seek ways to halt spillover from the war.

title.children: Hezbollah says it hit Israeli observation post with 62 rockets

image.altText: Two people in fire fighter uniforms stand outside a train with its windows burnt out.

props.synopsis: The alleged arson attack is the latest in as series of fires to hit railway services ahead of Sunday's national election.

title.children: Seven opposition party members arrested following alleged arson attack on train in Bangladesh

image.altText: Storm cells range with lightning thunder before a golden sunset glow

props.synopsis: Authorities say heavy rainfall is expected to arrive in the Victoria's north-west from Sunday night and move across the state, with residents warned to plan for flash flooding.

title.children: Storms, flash flooding likely in Victoria from today, with up to 200mm of rain possible in state's north

image.altText: A sign saying "The Royal Children's Hospital" sits in a garden in front of one of the facility's large, colourful buildings.

props.synopsis: A mother in her 20s is understood to have avoided contact with medical services throughout her pregnancy, but sought hospital assistance on the day of her baby's birth.

title.children: Newborn in critical condition after 'freebirth' in regional Victoria

image.altText: An EV powers an air fryer for a dinner on the beach

props.synopsis: Electric vehicle (EV) owners have used their cars to power homes during Queensland's extended electrical blackouts, including a couple who ran many of their household appliances off their EV – even an air fryer to cook a hot dinner.

title.children: Fans, phone chargers and the air fryer: Electric vehicle helps quick-thinking Queenslanders through extended blackout

image.altText: Jill Biden and Joen Biden laugh while standing at a podium in front of a large American flag

props.synopsis: Joe Biden accuses Republican Donald Trump, his likely 2024 election opponent, of instigating the January 6, 2021, attacks and plotting revenge on those seeking to punish him.

title.children: Biden puts January 6 at centre of election campaign, saying Trump seeks 'revenge' on those seeking to punish him

image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason photographed in court in his gown.

props.synopsis: Media being allowed to report on a powerful person facing criminal charges, could be argued, is textbook public interest journalism — so, why were reporters locked out of court when a Supreme Court judge appeared?

title.children: How the media ended up locked out of court when a judge faced criminal charges

image.altText: Mário Zagallo wearing glasses speaks at a desk at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Brazilian World Cup winning player and coach has died, according to a post on his official Instagram account. He was a member of the 1970 side often considered to be the best ever.

title.children: Four-time World Cup winner Mário Zagallo dies aged 92

image.altText: the outside of a disused building

props.synopsis: Four years after the building's basement was found riddled with cracks, worn out owner-occupiers are offered a solution to settle debt and mortgages.

title.children: 'No winners': Mascot Tower owner-occupiers offered possible sale of apartments to cancel debt

image.altText: A selfie of a blonde girl with blue eyes.

props.synopsis: ADHD medications, antidepressants, acne medication and even some antibiotics could impact your ability to detect heat stroke or increase your risk of sunburn. Here is why and what you can do about it.

title.children: Some medications impact your heat and sun sensitivity. Here's what they are and how to survive the hot summer

image.altText: Left image: house with graffiti and overgrown yard. Left image: renovated kitchen

props.synopsis: A renovator's dream, which during the 90s was known as "a bit of a party house", has helped a young couple get into Townsville's property market. But properties like theirs are becoming harder to find.

title.children: Katie turned this 'mouldy and disgusting' dump into a dream home and more than doubled its value

image.altText: A tribute of Michael Yung.

props.synopsis: Dr Michael Yung, who was allegedly murdered in his Adelaide home in December, was remembered by family, friends and colleagues at an emotional service on what would have been his birthday.

title.children: 'Evil must not win': Family, friends pay tribute to top Adelaide doctor at emotional funeral

image.altText: Australia batter David Warner and Marnus Labuschagne walk off the SCG past a sign reading Thanks Dave on the grass.

props.synopsis: Australia wraps up a 3-0 series victory over Pakistan, as David Warner falls 11 runs short of the perfect fairytale ending. Here are five quick hits from day four at the SCG.

title.children: Five quick hits — Warner provides near perfect swansong, Labuschagne comes alive as Aussie seal win

image.altText: Australia batter David Warner kisses the badge on his helmet as he walks off after being dismissed at the SCG.

props.synopsis: Australia wins the third Test against Pakistan at the SCG by eight wickets to complete a 3-0 clean sweep of the Test series.

title.children: David Warner steers Australia to victory in final innings at the SCG

image.altText: Trump in front of a flag

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court agrees to hear Donald Trump's appeal of a judicial decision barring the former president from the Colorado Republican primary ballot, taking up a politically explosive case with major implications for the 2024 presidential election.

title.children: US Supreme Court will hear Trump's appeal of Colorado disqualification

image.altText: A car burnt out with emergency services.

props.synopsis: Andrew Dodd and daughter Nadine have spent countless hours building their 1935 Ford Coupe — an adventure that first saw the duo racing to finish the car with one hour to go before Nadine's formal.

title.children: Dad-and-daughter duo rebuild dream car after engine fire, now it's a Summernats grand champion contender

image.altText: Rafael Nadal carries his bags as he leaves the court at the Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: Having undergone hip surgery last year, Rafael Nadal admits he is "a little bit more scared than usual" after needing treatment during his shock loss to Australian Jordan Thompson at the Brisbane International.

title.children: Nadal not '100 per cent sure' about Australian Open tilt after injury scare

image.altText: A man with a red hoodie and sunglasses on the top of his head looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A relative's fatal drug overdose sparked a second chance at life for Josh Calliss, who now shares his story in group therapy in an "amazing place" to help others beat addiction.

title.children: After 20 years of drug addiction, Josh had a second chance at life. Now he's helping others

image.altText: A close up image of Michael Bolton smiling on the red carpet before the Grammys

props.synopsis: The US singer-songwriter known for chart hits such as Said I Loved You… But I Lied, tells fans on social media he is recovering from "immediate surgery" after being diagnosed with a brain tumour.

title.children: Singer Michael Bolton has brain surgery to remove tumour

image.altText: An open black bag containing wrapped up packages of an illicit drug.

props.synopsis: More cocaine has washed on beaches between Sydney and Newcastle, with a large haul drifting into Botany this week, which has taken the total found over the past two weeks to 170 kilograms.

title.children: Cocaine castaway haul now at 170kg after another 50kg is found on NSW beaches

image.altText: A black and white photograph of 1930s racing cars with their drivers waiting to start.

props.synopsis: Every day, South Australians drive on the circuit of the state's first grand prix, but most have no idea of the history beneath their wheels.

title.children: Australia's forgotten grand prix was a coastal road race. Now memories are being revived

image.altText: a man works at a computer with a padlock graphic on the screen

props.synopsis: A suspected Russian ransomware hack on Victoria's court systems was the first major reported cyber attack on Australia's justice system — but a look overseas shows courts are popular targets for criminals.

title.children: Australia just had its first major reported cyber attack on a court system. Here's why it may have been targeted

image.altText: a man drives a boat out into calm water while two children sit at his feet.

props.synopsis: At the southern-most tip of the mainland, Corner Inlet fishermen have turned their gentle fishing practices into law to safeguard the bay and the livelihoods of future generations.

title.children: How a fishermen's pact 30 years ago to protect this bay is now creating a future for their children

image.altText: A photo of NRA CEO Wayne LaPierre speaking at a conference with a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: The longtime head of the National Rifle Association says he is resigning, just days before the start of a civil trial over allegations he diverted millions of dollars from the powerful gun rights organisation to pay for personal travel and other lavish perks.

title.children: NRA chief announces resignation days before trial

image.altText: A man smiling.

props.synopsis: US-born actor and singer David Soul, a 1970s icon for his role as Detective Kenneth "Hutch" Hutchinson in the classic TV crime series Starsky & Hutch, has died aged 80.

title.children: Starsky & Hutch actor David Soul dies aged 80

image.altText: A happy family on the beach.

props.synopsis: The number of child pedestrian deaths is not decreasing in Australia, according to new research, and advocates are calling for more educational campaigns and vehicle safety measures to address the issue.

title.children: Michelle's 4yo son was killed by a car 10 years ago. She's been fighting to reduce child road trauma ever since
